basic.description:
The field study of surficial deposits, rock types, and geological processes, based on the geology of the Kingston area. Descriptions, samples and measurements acquired on several field trips will be analyzed, and the results recorded in maps, sections, and reports throughout the course.
NOTE    Field trips and laboratories are 6 hours per week, and there is a required, full-day of geological mapping on a weekend later in the term.  Please contact the Department for more information.
LEARNING HOURS    120 (24L;60Lb;8G;4Oc;24P)
basic.subject: GEOL
basic.title: Geological Field Methods

extra.enrollment_requirement: Corequisite   GEOL 104 and GEOL232, or permission of the Department.
